issue.title: Ensure CompositeDefinitionProvider::__toString refactored into DefnitionProvider interface
issue.body: We are currently "hacking" our improved logging when using the CompositeDefinitionProvider. Instead of implementing `__toString` we should update the `DefinitionProvider` interface to require a `toString()` method. This requires v3 as changing the interface is a BC break.

comment.body: As we removed logging from AC directly and plan on moving it to a separate library it isn't clear what needs to be changed about this. Am closing this for now and may open a new issue when logging is re-implemented.

issue.title: Ensure CompositeDefinitionProvider::__toString refactored into DefnitionProvider interface
issue.body: We are currently "hacking" our improved logging when using the CompositeDefinitionProvider. Instead of implementing `__toString` we should update the `DefinitionProvider` interface to require a `toString()` method. This requires v3 as changing the interface is a BC break.

issue.title: Refactor methods to not use `get`
issue.body: The `get` prefix tends to be noisy with very little signal, especially since we make very little use of setter methods. All methods prefixed with `get` should have this prefix removed.

issue.title: Remove all references to injecting a property
issue.body: In 3.0 injecting a property was removed and is no longer supported. There are still lingering references to this in code and documentation. This should be removed.

issue.title: Refactor Bootstrap to use static constructors
issue.body:
Currently the Bootstrap object uses a public constructor with a relatively large amount of dependencies, all of them optional. For most out-of-the-box use cases there's only 1 or 2 of these that are typically necessary to provide. Having 1 constructor is not intuitive when you'd want to override dependencies and makes bootstrapping clunkier than it has to be.

In 3.0 a series of static constructor methods should be created that will satisfy common bootstrapping scenarios without always having to be exposed to the full complexity of bootstrapping.

commits.message:
Feature/bootstrap constructors (#378)

* Introduce DefaultDefinitionProviderFactory

* Use static Bootstrap constructors. Fixes #369

payload.description: Dependency Injection framework to configure a PSR-11 Container with Attributes!

issue.title: Improve experience providing active profiles during bootstrapping
issue.body:
Currently users provide a list of active profiles when bootstrapping the container. Internally this gets turned into an instance of the interface `Cspray\AnnotatedContainer\Profiles\ActiveProfiles`. This leads to a clunky experience, as the user may need to do something with the profiles during container setup, which would be better if the explicit type was used. In addition, container factories clunkily implement this interface and there are implementation details of the factory implementations that could be cleaned up if this type was provided for us.

The interface `ActiveProfiles` should be converted to a class, with static constructor methods for creating the type with common use cases. The `ActiveProfilesBuilder` and `ActiveProfilesParser`, interface and implementations, will become superfluous and should be removed.

issue.title: Allow functional API to define an Attribute implementation
issue.body: In 2.x the functional API does not allow defining an Attribute on a Definition. Intuitively, this might make sense; after all, you aren't adding the Definition with an Attribute so there's nothing to supply. However, this does not take into consideration the possibility of custom Attributes. If these Attributes hold metadata, for example [in the PSR-15 microframework demo](https://github.com/cspray/annotated-container-microframework) the `#[Controller('GET', '/path')]` has routing data associated with it. If you were to use the functional API there'd be no way to provide this information.

issue.title: Refactor functional API to return definitions and not be DefinitionProviderContext aware
issue.body:
Currently the functional API is a bit clunky and requires a `DefinitionProviderContext` be passed as the first argument. This is largely an artifact of dealing with an immutable data structure, the `ContainerDefinitionBuilder`, and needing to provide a solution for that. The solution provided in 2.x is less than ideal.

In 3.x the `DefinitionProviderContext` has been updated to expose more appropriate methods for adding the different types of definitions. This updated will allow us to change the functional API into one that's a bit easier to reason about. The functions should returns definitions that get added via the `DefinitionProviderContext`.

issue.title: Refactor methods to not use `get`
issue.body: The `get` prefix tends to be noisy with very little signal, especially since we make very little use of setter methods. All methods prefixed with `get` should have this prefix removed.

issue.title: Update to allow using PHP-Parser 5+
issue.body: This will require updating the cspray/annotated-target library.
